DEFINITIONS: ERROR 404

Posted on4 April, 202122 April, 2021AuthorLou Alvarez

Error 404 is the HTTP status code by which a web server indicates to a browser that the page searched for has not been found. Therefore we would be talking about a broken link, damaged or simply that it no longer appears and it is not possible to access it.
It is one of the most common mistakes to find when browsing the internet when we do a search. Our connection works perfectly, the only thing is that it returns us in the form of an error what it could not find, we have no communication problems.

404 error numbers each have a meaning.

  • The 4 indicates that the web we are looking for no longer exists.
  • 0 indicates a coordination error
  • The last 4 reports a specific problem different from the rest of the problems.

When our page returns a 404 to Internet users, we have to solve it immediately since it is negative for our website. We can lose credibility because of this error and it will negatively affect our web positioning. And it is that the search engines do not like this type of error and our results in the search engines will lose all relevance.

 

Fix Error 404

Fortunately we can fix it so that it does not appear again when someone wants to browse our page. The important thing is to know how to detect it in time and for this the internet offers us free tools with which to remedy it.

The main reason this error can arise is because our website has been removed. This bug is solved by replacing the content you had with a new one and doing a redirect.

Another reason for 404 is that our link is not well written. If it is a link, to remedy it, it will be enough to edit the link and correct it. If it is an external page that links to ours, we will have to add the misspelled URL to our content management system. We will also have to add a 301 redirect to the specific site.
If when modifying the name to a website we forget to redirect it to the new one, it will be enough to redirect to the 301 that we mentioned previously.
